resources.name: crop_data

fields.name: year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested. It will generally have been sown the previous year

fields.name: block
fields.title: Block
fields.description: The experiment is divided into 5 Blocks

fields.name: main_plot
fields.title: Main plot
fields.description: The main plots on each block which have different cropping. There are 40 pairs of main plots, eg 3 and 4, one plot received FYM (last applied 1963) the other without FYM.

fields.name: split_plot
fields.title: Split plot
fields.description: Split-plots which have different N fertilizer treatments

fields.name: plot_code
fields.title: Plot code
fields.description: A unique identifying code for each split-plot (i.e. the experimental units)

fields.name: previous_FYM_factor_level
fields.title: Previous FYM factor level
fields.description: Code for the previous FYM factor level applied 1956-1967, as explained in previous_fym_facogtr_data sheet

fields.name: N_factor_level
fields.title: N factor level
fields.description: Code for the N fertilizer level, N0, N1, N2 or N3 (nil, low, medium or high) in the different periods of the experiment, as explained in n_factor_data sheet

fields.name: N_factor_code
fields.title: N factor code
fields.description: Code for the inorganic nitrogen fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year to the split-plots.

fields.name: N_fertilizer_amount
fields.title: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied to this crop.

fields.name: number_of_N_applications
fields.title: Number of N fertilizer applications
fields.description: Number of fertilizer N applications to this crop and in this year.

fields.name: rotation_factor_level
fields.title: rotation
fields.description: Code for crop rotation on this block and on this year

fields.name: basal_P_kg
fields.title: basal P fertilizer amount
fields.description: Amount of basal phosphorus fertilizer applied in that harvest year. Applied as triple superphosphate 2000-2018 and as compound fertilizer 1976-1999

fields.name: date_P
fields.title: P fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date phosphorus fertilizer applied in that harvest year. Usually applied in the autumn to stubble of preceeding crop.

fields.name: basal_K_kg
fields.title: basal K fertilizer amount
fields.description: Amount of basal potassium fertilizer applied in that harvest year. Applied as potassium sulfate 2000-2018 and as compound fertilizer 1976-1999.

fields.name: date_K
fields.title: K fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date potassium fertilizer applied in that harvest year. Usually applied in early spring

fields.name: basal_S_kg
fields.title: basal S fertilizer amount
fields.description: Amount of basal sulfur fertilizer applied in that harvest year. Applied as potassium sulfate 2000-2018. Not applied 1976-1999.

fields.name: date_S
fields.title: S fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date sulfur fertilizer applied in that harvest year. Usually applied in early spring

fields.name: cultivar
fields.title: Wheat cultivar
fields.description: Wheat cultivar or variety

fields.name: sow_date
fields.title: Sowing date
fields.description: Date the crop was sown, generally in the autumn in the year before harvest

fields.name: harvest_date
fields.title: Harvest date
fields.description: Date the crop was harvested

fields.name: grain_yield
fields.title: Grain yield
fields.description: Harvested wheat grain yield at 85% dry matter

fields.name: note_id
fields.title: Note identification
fields.description: Note number

resources.title: crop yield  data
resources.description: This is the main data table, containing the yield of wheat grown as the first test crop, 1976-2018. This dataset only contains plots on which wheat was grown as the first test crop in a given year. So for example, all plots in block 3 had wheat planted to them in 1976, but there is no data for any other blocks this year because none were growing wheat as the first test crop. ''Test crop' refers to a major cash crop on which the effects of the different arable rotations and leys were assessed. These have changed throughout the experiment, and the first test crop has been wheat since 1976. The rotations are typically 3 years of 'treatment crops' followed by two years of 'test crops' (the exception are the eight-year ley treatments). Also contains details of N fertilizer treatments, basal P, K and S fertilizer applications, sowing and harvest dates and wheat variety. Grain yields at 85% dry matter

resources.name: n_factor_data

fields.name: factor_label
fields.title: Factor label
fields.description: Label for the factor level

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A description of the factor level

fields.name: factor_level_name

fields.description: The name for a factor level

fields.name: factor_level_code
fields.title: Factor level code
fields.description: Code explaining breakdown of fertilizer N applications for the different factor levels

fields.name: years
fields.title: Years
fields.description: The harvest year range for when the factor level was used (harvest year refers to the year when the crop was harvested. It was generally sown the previous autumn).

fields.name: treatment_factor
fields.title: Treatment factor
fields.description: The label for the treatment factor

fields.name: treatment_factor_rdfType
fields.title: Treatment factor rdfType
fields.description: A controlled vocabulary URI for the treatment factor

fields.name: amount
fields.title: Amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen (N) fertilizer which was applied to this crop as a treatment factor. This does not include N in FYM or rape cake. Note at different periods of the experiment N was variously applied in autumn or spring and applied in a single application or split applications. Timings and amounts of N applied are indicated in the crop_data table in the fields autumn_n_kg, autumn_n_date, spring1_n_kg, spring1_n_date, spring2_n_kg and spring2_n_date

fields.name: amount unit
fields.title: Amount unit
fields.description: Units in which the N was applied each year

fields.name: frequency
fields.title: Frequency
fields.description: The frequency at which the factor level treatment was applied; once a year or three times a year, all in the spring

fields.name: treatment_form
fields.title: Treatment form
fields.description: The form of inorganic N fertilizer applied

fields.name: treatment_form_rdfType
fields.title: Treatment form rdfType
fields.description: A controlled vocabulary URI for the treatment factor level form

resources.title: N fertilizer treatment factor level descriptions
resources.description: Describes the different N (nitrogen) fertilizer  treatment factor levels used 1976-2018.

resources.title: Crop rotation descriptions
resources.description: Describes the different ley and arable rotations.

name: woburn-ley-arable-experiment:-yields-of-wheat-as-the-first-test-crop,-1976-2018
title: Woburn Ley-arable experiment: yields of wheat as the first test crop, 1976-2018
description:
### Abstract
Annual grain yield for the winter wheat test crop, on the Woburn Ley-Arable experiment, 1976-2018, with treatment details.
### Methods
The Woburn Ley-arable experiment was started in 1938, to compare the effects of different rotations, with and without grass or grass/clover leys, on soil organic matter and the yield of two arable test crops.  'Test crop' refers to a major cash crop on which the effects of the different arable rotations and leys were assessed. The rotations are typically three years of 'treatment crops' followed by two years of 'test crops' (the exception are the eight-year ley treatments). The two test crops have changed throughout the experiment, and the first test crop has been wheat since 1976.  This dataset contains the yield of wheat grown as the first test crop, 1976-2018, plus details of the N fertilizer treatments, basal fertilizer, sowing and harvest dates.
### Technical Info
Wheat grain yield at harvest at 85% dry matter content. Winter wheat was grown every year, except for 2015, when the spring wheat variety Mulika was sown, as the winter wheat crop failed.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. Once the data were entered into e-RA, they were independently back-checked against the original data sheets.
